repnme.cdata!:
Chile - Second Santiago Water Supply and
            Sewerage Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Second Santiago Water and Sewerage
            Project in Chile. The project had three objectives: a) to
            support the first phase of a plan to alleviate the sewage
            disposal and reuse problems with a view to reducing the
            incidence of typhoid fever and other enteric diseases; b) to
            upgrade potable water quality and increase available water
            quantity by improving operation and maintenance and reducing
            water losses in the water distribution system; and c) to
            strengthen the management and cost control system of the
            Empresa Metropolitana de Obras Sanitarias (EMOS). Overall,
            Bank performance was satisfactory. EMOS is considered one of
            the more efficient water utilities in Latin America. Overall
            its performance has been very satisfactory, especially after
            overcoming initial delays. The relationship between the Bank
            and the Borrower was generally cordial. The main lessons to
            be learned from this project are: a) Significant
            improvements in the performance of the sector and its
            utilities require a well-functioning regulatory and
            institutional framework; b) To avoid unnecessary delays in
            project implementation, it is essential to have detailed
            designs for a given percentage of the project subcomponents
            before project effectiveness; c) In the case of an
            experienced and efficient utility such as EMOS, a project
            designed from the outset to finance a time slice of its
            investment program versus a project approach would have
            precluded the adjustments needed to accommodate the shift in
            priority as it emerged during project implementation.
            Overall, Bank performance was satisfactory. EMOS is
            considered one of the more efficient water utilities in
            Latin America. Overall its performance has been very
            satisfactory, especially after overcoming initial delays.
            The relationship between the Bank and the Borrower was
            generally cordial.

repnme.cdata!:
Chile - Second Santiago Water Supply and
            Sewerage and Valparaiso Water Supply Reconstruction Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Santiago Water Supply and
            Sewerage Project will be for: (i) Sewerage: construction of
            about 70 km of trunk mains and 200 km of collection sewers,
            a pilot sewage treatment plant and 13 waste water
            stabilization ponds; (ii) Water supply: construction of
            about 150 km of trunk and distribution mains, about 80,000
            cubic meters of reservoir storage and about 30 wells; and
            (iii) General operations: technical assistance, construction
            of operations building for the Santiago Sanitary Works
            Company (EMOS), operating equipment, office equipment and
            water meters. In Valparaiso, the project will be for: (i)
            Water supply: construction of a 5,000 cubic meters reservoir
            and a 500 l/sec surface water treatment plant, and
            connection of about 1,500 houses and rehabilitation of a 750
            l/sec surface water treatment plant; and (ii) Operations and
            studies: general technical assistance, project preparation
            studies and operations equipment. The project in Santiago
            would be for: (i) Sewerage: construction of about 70 km of
            trunk mains and 200 km of collection sewers, a pilot sewage
            treatment plant and 13 waste water stabilization ponds; (ii)
            Water supply: construction of about 150 km of trunk and
            distribution mains, about 80,000 cubic meters of reservoir
            storage and about 30 wells; and (iii) General operations:
            technical assistance, construction of operations building
            for the Santiago Sanitary Works Company (EMOS), operating
            equipment, office equipment and water meters. In Valparaiso,
            the project would be for: (i) Water supply: construction of
            a 5,000 cubic meters reservoir and a 500 l/sec surface water
            treatment plant, and connection of about 1,500 houses and
            rehabilitation of a 750 l/sec surface water treatment plant;
            and (ii) Operations and studies: general technical
            assistance, project preparation studies and operations equipment.
